intro: Dichapetalum rugosum, commonly known as the roughleaf dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, wooded areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
